name: Das Telekommando kehrt zurück
description:
In the followup to Das Telekommando, the promotional adventure game made for Deutsche Telekom, you play as a telecom serviceman (or servicewoman) who must repair a video conference connection at the headquarters of a nature protection association. It soon turns out that there has been a sabotage, with everything from the air conditioning to the lifts and telephones being put out of action. You have only your mobile phone and your toolbox to help you out.

First you must repair the lift, then you can roam more freely, talking to the workers of the house, finding clues and performing repairs. The game is very non-technical, and has a very relaxed relation to its sponsor, with the main character sometimes talking like a proud state employee (this was in 1993), rather than a telephone salesman, directly to the player. Still, most puzzles and their solutions revolve around early-90s high tech such as modems, faxes, satellite equipment, mobile phones and videotex terminals.

Telekommando II is a short point-and-click adventure that takes place entirely within the confines of one building. You have your typical inventory and list of verbs at the bottom. There are only 7 verbs at your disposal. One difference compared to the LucasArts adventures is that you can't walk your character around the screen. He or she will only walk when it's necessary for completing an action you've chosen.
publishedBy: Deutsche Telekom AG, Art Department Werbeagentur GmbH

shot.caption: Title screen
This story takes place in the headquarters of the association "Umwelt 2000", where an international video conference is to be held in the afternoon
But suddenly, all the lines are down. Could it be an accident – or willing sabotage?
The Telekom is contacted, and immediately, a white service wagon is sent out.
Choose between serviceman and servicewoman.
Your service wagon outside Umwelt 2000's offices.
In the lobby, chatting to the receptionist.
The staircases are sealed off because they've been newly painted.
In the cellar, a strange man is meddling with the air conditioning.
In the cafeteria, talking to the data entrist, whose uncle happens to have drawn the plans for the building.
In the cellar, you find a ladder and a satellite dish.
With the ladder and your trusty tool kit, you can mend the lift.
You reach the fourth floor and talk to the errand boy, who is absorbed by his "Klotztris" game.
In the video conference room, a French woman and an Englishman are waiting.
Talking to the manager. You also find a SIM card in her office.
She gives you the fax list with confirmations that must be sent to the other participants. But the fax line is down!
Here is the fax and a top modern PC. But someone has deleted the operating system.
You borrow a system floppy from the in-house programmer.
"Not without my rubber ducky!"
You find the telephone switch, but it has been put out of order.
Trying to fit the parts in the right slots.
You give up and call up the Telekom technical office.
You can now send the confirmation faxes, after having checked an unreadable number with the Japanese telecomms on your mobile phone. Ah, the wonders of modern telecommunications!
In the accounting office, you find a BTX (videotel) terminal.
You open the air duct in the cellar to reach the sealed-off third floor, but first you must have the plans for the building so you know where to crawl.
Trying to guess the password for the terminal program on the PC.
After having acquired the plans via modem and printed them out, you find that they are in French. Thankfully, you can ask the French conference participant for help.
The Englishman chats about the nice weather. "But it's supposed to rain today!" "Why yes, I hope so!"
You crawl the air duct to the third floor.
The third floor has been occupied by the criminal organisation S.T.Ö.R.
You need to falsify a letter using this copying machine.
Trying to fix the machine. It is out of both paper and toner.
The accountant keeps quiet now that you've ordered him a pizza on your mobile phone, and you can use his BTX terminal to quickly order a new toner for the copying machine.
Fixing the satellite dish.
